abstract: The Serpentine Gallery in London announced on Tuesday that the architectural firm Herzog & de Meuron and the artist Ai Weiwei -- the brain trust behind the Beijing National Stadium, aka the Bird's Nest -- will collaborate again to create the 2012 Serpentine Gallery Pavilion.
lead_paragraph: The Serpentine Gallery in London announced on Tuesday that the architectural firm Herzog & de Meuron and the artist Ai Weiwei -- the brain trust behind the Beijing National Stadium, aka the Bird's Nest -- will collaborate again to create the 2012 Serpentine Gallery Pavilion. The twelfth commission in an annual series of temporary pavilions erected on the gallery's grounds in Hyde Park, the new structure will be a bowl-shaped auditorium carved into the earth and protected by a flat, circular steel roof raised five feet above ground level. The space will be open to use by the public, as well as for speaking engagements and other programmed events.

headline.main: Ai Weiwei and Herzog & de Meuron to Design Serpentine Pavilion
